div.p: Since it was first passed in 1966, the FOIA has evolved
through many Congressional amendments and judicial interpretations.
It is the Executive Branch, led by the President,
that is responsible for the administration of the FOIA across the government.
Simply put, President Obama has pledged to make this the most transparent Administration in history.
In that spirit, Attorney General Eric Holder, the head of the Department of Justice,
has directed agencies to apply a presumption of openness to every FOIA request.
That standard favors disclosure whenever possible.
The Attorney General also encouraged agencies to make more information available online,
without the need for people to have to make FOIA requests.
The Department of Justice's Office of Information Policy
oversees agency compliance with these directives
and encourages all agencies to fully comply with both the letter and the spirit of the FOIA -
a spirit of transparency that makes our democracy unique.
